title: How long does a wage garnishment last?
question: I have a judgment against someone. I had a wage garnishment served. Do I have to have another one served every week (he gets paid weekly) or will it last for awhile or until the judgment is paid. Also, if the debtor is a 1099 employee, do I only get 25% of the gross or can I get it all?
answers: Mr Loker is right - they can keep garnishing till the payment has been paid in full
The wage garnishment lasts until the judgment is satisfied. Also, 25% is the max
